summary.para: The AMCOPPStatusInput structure contains a Certified Output Protection Protocol (COPP) status request.

remarks.para: The following COPP status requests are defined.

item.description: Returns the type of physical connector to the output device.
Returns the available protection mechanisms for the physical connector.
Returns the protection level that is currently set through the COPP mechanism in the context of this session.
Returns the actual protection level that is currently set for the physical connector.
Returns information describing the signal that is being transmitted over the connector associated with the COPP device.
Returns the High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection (HDCP) characteristics of the output device.
Returns information about the type of bus used by the graphics hardware associated with this COPP device.

remarks.para: For more information, see the Windows DDK documentation.

summary.para: GUID that defines the status request.
Sequence number. The application must keep a running count of the COPP status requests issued. For each request, increment the sequence number by one.
Number of bytes of valid data in the StatusData member.
Data for the status request. The meaning of the data depends on the request.
